TOP STORIESBush Orders Tougher Sanctions On Sudan
President Bush ordered new U.S. economic sanctions to pressure Sudan's government to halt the bloodshed in Darfur that the
                        administration has condemned as genocide. "The world has a responsibility to put an end to it," Mr. Bush said. More...Watch: Bush Orders Sanctions On Sudan

There are water restrictions, crop failures, wildfires, and little rain in the forecast for the Southeast, suffering one of
                        its worst droughts in decades. It may take a very wet tropical storm to put a dent in it. More...

A former prime minister and a political newcomer will face each other in a June 12 runoff for leader of Israel's Labor Party.
                        Either way, it's likely the nation's once-dominant party will cut its alliance with current Prime Minister Ehud Olmert. More...
